author: Staff Reporter
text:
The 13th State conference of the Democratic Youth Federation of India (DYFI) concluded at Tirur on Thursday with a massive rally and a public function.

The three-day conference decided to do everything possible to encourage the youth to take to agriculture. A.N. Shamzir and M. Swaraj were elected State president and secretary respectively. P. Biju was elected treasurer.

V.P. Rajeena, K. Manikandan, I. Saju, P.K. Abdulla Navas, and Nithin Kanicheri were elected vice presidents. K. Rajesh, Biju Kandakai, P. Nikhil, and K. Premkumar were elected joint secretaries.

CPI(M) State secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan inaugurated the public function. Mr. Shamzir presided.

The conference adopted 19 resolutions. Mr. Shamzir and Mr. Swaraj said the DYFI would give support to only those who were willing to address the issues being faced by the youth.

They said unlike the Youth Congress, the DYFI was not the tail of a political party. “It is an independent organisation,” they said.

DYFI leaders said they would launch campaigns against increasing intolerance and communalisation in the country.

A.N. Shamzir elected DYFI State president,

M. Swaraj secretary
title: DYFI Kerala State meet concludes
